titleproper.value:
Guide to the Marie Walsh Papers
                    <num>AIA.034</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Rebecca Altermatt

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2014-06-13T11:06-0400</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value:
The collection contains correspondence from Marie Walsh to editors of the 
                <emph render="italic">New York Times</emph> and members of Congress including Daniel Moynihan and Joseph Biden. Letters to the former discuss media coverage of activities of the IRA by the American press while those to Congress deal with Ms. Walsh's opposition to the Supplementary Extradition Treaty, eventually passed during the Reagan Administration. Other materials include an article authored by Ms. Walsh on the originations of Sinn Fein and proceedings from a conference held at Columbia University in 1994 on the MacBride Principles.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Marie Walsh Papers; AIA 034; box number; folder number; Archives of Irish America, Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Donated by Marie Walsh in 1999. The accession number associated with this gift is 1997.034.

The collection contains correspondence from Marie Walsh to editors of the 
                <emph render="italic">New York Times</emph> and members of Congress including Daniel Moynihan and Joseph Biden. Letters to the former discuss media coverage of activities of the IRA by the American press while those to Congress deal with Ms. Walsh's opposition to the Supplementary Extradition Treaty, eventually passed during the Reagan Administration. Other materials include an article authored by Ms. Walsh on the originations of Sinn Fein and proceedings from a conference held at Columbia University in 1994 on the MacBride Principles.
